fields.description: When eucalyptus-cloud process is killed on ENABLED Walrus, failover does not occur.
fields.summary: Walrus does not failover in HA if eucalyptus-cloud process is killed on primary
fields.environment:
HA Environment:

2 x CLC/Walrus
2 x CC
1 x SC
5 x NCs

comments.body:
Started investigation.  Setup is as follows:

{code}

*Primary CLC/Walrus*

[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	storage        	enter-the-wu   	method-man     	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.103:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:storage:method-man/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	DISABLED  	15  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	iron-flag      	DISABLED  	15  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:iron-flag/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	wu-tang-forever	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:wu-tang-forever/
SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	gza            	ENABLED   	15  	http://192.168.39.104:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:gza/

version: 8.3.13 (api:88/proto:86-96)

    ns:0 nr:15577200 dw:15577200 dr:0 al:0 bm:7 lo:0 pe:0 ua:0 ap:0 ep:1 wo:b oos:0
{code}

Confirmed.

Steps followed to reproduce:

*(Kill eucalyptus-cloud process on viking-01)*

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# ps aux | grep eucalyptus-cloud
root      7107  0.0  0.0  10448   176 ?        Ss   Jul26   0:00 eucalyptus-cloud -Dwalrus.storage.manager=DRBDStorageManager --log-level=debug -h / -u eucalyptus --pidfile //var/run/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-cloud.pid -f -L console-log -o //var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log -e //var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log
498       7181 22.4  3.6 6505116 572036 ?      Sl   Jul26 2935:54 eucalyptus-cloud -Dwalrus.storage.manager=DRBDStorageManager --log-level=debug -h / -u eucalyptus --pidfile //var/run/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-cloud.pid -f -L console-log -o //var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log -e //var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log
root     25798  0.0  0.0 103244   880 pts/0    S+   12:02   0:00 grep eucalyptus-cloud

[root@viking-01 ~]# kill -9 7107 7181
[root@viking-01 ~]# killall -9 eucalyptus-cloud
eucalyptus-cloud: no process killed

[root@viking-01 ~]# cat /proc/drbd;date

SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	26  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.102/

SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	wu-tang-forever	NOTREADY  	26  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:wu-tang-forever/
SERVICE	storage        	enter-the-wu   	method-man     	ENABLED   	26  	http://192.168.39.103:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:storage:method-man/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	NOTREADY  	26  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.101/

{code}

*(Waited 20 mins later)*

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# date;euca-describe-services

SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	gza            	ENABLED   	158 	http://192.168.39.104:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:gza/

SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	158 	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.102/

*(Walrus service came back online in 10 minutes after starting back up the eucalyptus-cloud process on the viking-01)*

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# date;euca-describe-services 
Sat Aug  4 12:30:59 PDT 2012
SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	gza            	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.104:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:gza/

SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	iron-flag      	DISABLED  	165 	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:iron-flag/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	wu-tang-forever	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:wu-tang-forever/
SERVICE	storage        	enter-the-wu   	method-man     	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.103:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:storage:method-man/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	DISABLED  	165 	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	165 	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.168.39.102/

[root@viking-01 ~]# date;cat /proc/drbd
Sat Aug  4 12:39:37 PDT 2012
version: 8.3.13 (api:88/proto:86-96)
GIT-hash: 83ca112086600faacab2f157bc5a9324f7bd7f77 build by dag@Build64R6, 2012-05-07 11:52:13

 1: cs:Connected ro:Primary/Secondary ds:UpToDate/UpToDate C r-----
    ns:15577260 nr:0 dw:15544492 dr:6954838 al:3858 bm:7 lo:0 pe:0 ua:0 ap:0 ep:1 wo:b oos:0
{code}

Darren, we can reproduce this issue as well.

Vic and I are discussing how best to handle this.

If the walrus process is forcibly killed (kill -9), we don't
automatically fail over.

There isn't a simple fix but we are investigating.



On Sep 12, 2012, at 7:47 PM, "Darren Stagnaro (JIRA)"

Just a note that we're not going to be able to address this in the 3.2.0 release.  As a workaround, use the kill (without -9) which will cause the automatic failover.  A better solution for manually testing HA capability is to stop the service, which performs an orderly shutdown.

I'm wondering, as part of our install, should we not set the eucalyptus-cloud process to a value of -17 in /proc/<pid>/oom_adj? Or at least set it something low so it's not one of the first processes killed?

If oomkiller runs at all then the entire system is suspect.  One could prevent eucalyptus from being first on the chopping block like you suggest, but _something_ will be killed, we won't usually know what it was, and even if we did, we can't possibly be prepared to react to every situation.

While the fix for heavy memory use clearly involves fixing eucalyptus code, perhaps the best sysadmin-level response to this sort of issue is to limit the amount of memory available to eucalyptus so eucalyptus can't starve the entire system.  If you're looking to explicitly address low-memory situations then knowing for sure that eucalyptus will be the one to crash is preferable to having a more-or-less random process die instead.

Is oomkiller really on-topic for this bug?

In case of a "kill -9" (the Eucalyptus process is forcibly terminated), it is possible to perform a manual failover by running "drbdadm secondary <resource name, e.g., r0>" on the primary Walrus (the one that was forcibly shut down) host.

This will result in the secondary Walrus acquiring control.

So there is a known way to deal with this failure.

Hi,

Scoping version is 3.1.3, can we get an update on the release this could make into?
Re-assigning this to myself for further review and investigation.
Will put in KB article around recovery of DRBD when Walrus process is killed.
Please note when documenting this that a failover WILL occur correctly when a normal process termination/service stop is performed during maintenance.
